meta.notes: Fake, in-universe, non-mechanical reviews for ships, speeders, and tanks. Intentionally unreliable and atmospheric.

vehicleReviews: Fast enough that I regretted it immediately.
Turns fine unless you actually need to turn.
Smells like fuel and bad decisions.
Arrived with scorch marks. Rendarr says cosmetic.
Brakes are more of a suggestion.
Why does it drift on sand.
Looks impressive. Handles worse than expected.
I didn't realize how loud this would be.
The cockpit rattles when you hit speed.
Delivery took forever but it did arrive.
Seats are not made for long trips.
Fast in a straight line. Terrible everywhere else.
Why does it hum like that.
You feel powerful right up until you try to stop.
Came with a smell that never left.
I would not recommend urban environments.
Feels like it wants to flip.
Delivery crew refused to explain the scratches.
Good for intimidation. Bad for comfort.
Fast enough to scare my passengers.
Handling improves if you don't think too hard.
I don't think the seat was new.
Why does it lean like that.
Feels built for combat, not comfort.
I wouldn't loan this to anyone.
Turns better at speed than slow.
Feels dangerous in a fun way.
You hear the engine more than your thoughts.
Handling is weird on uneven ground.
This is not a commuter vehicle.
Feels like it wants to keep going.
Fast in the open. Awful in cities.
I got used to it eventually.
Why does it pull to the left.
Feels like it was designed by soldiers.
I'd buy it again. I'd complain again too.
